means: 赶上( catch的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He did not like to be caught out on details.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不喜欢在细节上被人抓住把柄。

sentence.Network_en: If he is caught again he will be given a custodial sentence.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果他再次被捕，将会被处以监禁。

sentence.Network_en: Any child who is caught will be kept in at playtime.
sentence.Network_cn: 凡是被抓住的孩子在课间游戏时要被留在屋里。

entry.def: Caught is the past tense and past participle of catch.

list.explanation: 非常不愿意让别人看见或发现(却无可奈何地被人看见或发现)

example.en: I wouldn't be caught dead in that dress.
example.zh: 我很不愿意人家看见我穿那身衣服。

auth_sentence.content: If caught during pregnancy, it can cause miscarriage.
auth_sentence.res_content: If caught during pregnancy, it can cause miscarriage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If caught during pregnancy, it can cause miscarriage.

auth_sentence.content: But very few have ever been caught en route.
auth_sentence.res_content: But very few have ever been caught en route.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But very few have ever been caught en route.

auth_sentence.content: I have never seen him caught at mid-on before.
auth_sentence.res_content: I have never seen him caught at mid-on before.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have never seen him caught at mid-on before.

Sentence.sentence: The reason it hasn't caught on yet, he tells me, is that the functionality of e-edition textbooks is incredibly limited, and some students just aren't motivated to learn new study behavior.
Jane may be caught in a traffic jam.
Getting Away with it - Or Not Those who don't get caught pay an even higher price

means.word_mean: 卷入两者的争执中并因此遭殃；遭受池鱼之殃

sentences.en: When two industrial giants clash, small companies can get caught in the crossfire.
sentences.cn: 两大工业企业争斗之下，小公司遭受池鱼之殃。
